column2: The Cult of the Destroyer worship Ahriman sometimes called Angra Mainyu, and refuse the shackles of conventional belief. Their spirituality is instead centered around personal gain and merciless vanquishing of ones enemies, condemning them in the eyes of traditional believers.
The High Priest of the Cult of the Destroyer.
Recruit to the Cult of the Destroyer
Has not been approached by the Cult of the Destroyer before.
Attempt to find out whether §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! is open to the power of the occult. If so, you may invite [Root.GetHerHim] to become a member of the Cult of the Destroyer.
Recruit to the Cult of Balor
Has not been approached by the Cult of Balor before.
Attempt to find out whether §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! is open to the power of the occult. If so, you may invite [Root.GetHerHim] to become a member of the Cult of Balor.
The Cult of Cybele worship the Anatolian mother goddess Cybele, called by the Romans Magna Mater, believing her to be the protector of the Roman State.
The high priest of the Cult of Cybele, held to the highest standards of Chastity.
Recruit to the Cult of Cybele
The Cult of Despoina worship the Arcadian goddess Despoina, goddess of the Spring.
The high priest of the Cult of Despoina, guardian of its secrets.
Recruit to the Cult of Despoina
The Cult of Orpheus revere the mythical poet Orpheus who descended into the underworld and returned.
The high priest of the Cult of Orpheus, keeper of its secrets.
Recruit to the Cult of Orpheus

The Brotherhood of Saint James is the monastic order of the Apostolic Church in the Holy Land. It's main mission is to maintain and safeguard Church property in the Holy Land and gain more influence worldwide. The monastic order also takes care of the sick and hungry, and educates young priests.
Tsayraguyn Vardapet of the Brotherhood of Saint James
In secret, Adoptionist faithfuls have organized around a small church community in this province. From there it converts others, grows, and protects their own.
In secret, Apostolic faithfuls have organized around a small church community in this province. From there it converts others, grows, and protects their own.

In secret, Zurvanist faithfuls have organized around a small church community in this province. From there it converts others, grows, and protects their own.
Adoptionists reject the Holy Trinity, believing that Jesus Christ was adopted as God's son at his ascension, chosen because of his sinless devotion to the will of God.
The High Priest, leading the international effort of bringing more people into the fold.

Believing Christ to be of one incarnate nature, these are Christians who will not give up their faith, even when circumstance has forced them to renounce their words. They continue the good work, building their faith and their church, knowing in their hearts that they are doing God's will.
The High Priest, leading the international effort of bringing more people into the fold.

The Al-Asnam faith predates the rise of Islam in the Arab world, centered on the worship of a pantheon of Gods led by the three goddesses: al-Lat, al-Uzza, and Manat, all of whom are daughters of the Creator God, Allah.
The High Priest, leading the international effort of bringing more people into the fold.

Originally founded by the pharaoh Akhenaten, this heresy usurped the position of supreme god, typically held by Amun, with Aten. In addition, this heresy completely disowns the other Kemetic gods in complete favour of Aten.
The High Priest, leading the international effort of bringing more people into the fold.
Bektashism is a Sufi mystic order whose central tenet is the Wahdat-ul-Wujood - the single unified entity Allah-Muhammed-Ali.
The High Priest, leading the international effort of bringing more people into the fold.

Tamazight is the ancient religion of the Berbers, worshipping a pantheon of gods such as Ammon the Giver of Life, Afri the Goddess of Fortune and Fertility, Gurzil the Bringer of War, and Tannit the Weaver.
The High Priest, leading the international effort of bringing more people into the fold.
Celtic paganism claims to be one of the last surviving branches of the ancient druidic belief systems.
The High Priest, leading the international effort of bringing more people into the fold.
Celtic paganism claims to be one of the last surviving branches of the ancient druidic belief systems.
The High Druid of $SOCIETY|Y$, leading the international effort of bringing more people into the fold.

Seeing themselves as walking in the footsteps of the Apostles who first built the Church in the name of Christ, there are Christians who will not give up their faith, even when circumstance has forced them to renounce their words. They continue the good work, building their faith and their church, knowing in their hearts that they are doing God's will.
column3: Pensant suivre les pas des apôtres qui ont construit l'Église au nom du Christ, il y a des chrétiens qui ne renonceront pas à leur foi, même lorsque les circonstances les auront forcés à renoncer à l'exprimer. Ils continuent le bon travail, renforçant leur foi et leur Église, sachant au fond d'eux-mêmes qu'ils exaucent la volonté de Dieu.
column4: Sie sehen sich selbst als Nachfolger der Apostel, die zu Beginn im Namen von Jesus Christus die Kirche aufgebaut haben, und wenden sich auch dann nicht von ihrem Glauben ab, wenn sie durch äußere Umstände dazu gezwungen werden, ihre Lehren zu verleugnen. Sie setzen ihr gutes Werk und den Aufbau ihres Glaubens und ihrer Kirche fort, da sie in ihren Herzen wissen, dass sie den Willen von Gott ausführen.
column6: Hay cristianos que se ven a sí mismos siguiendo los pasos de los apóstoles que fundaron la Iglesia en nombre de Cristo, y que no renunciarán a su fe, aun cuando las circunstancias los han forzado a callar sus plegarias. Continúan con su buena labor, construyendo su fe y su iglesia, sabiendo en lo hondo de su alma que están siguiendo la voluntad de Dios.

column2: The High Priest, leading the international effort of bringing more people into the fold.
The Kemetic religion is polytheistic, with a large selection of gods and cults.
The High Priest, leading the international effort of bringing more people into the fold.

Germanic paganism refers to the diverse pre-Christian beliefs of the continental Germanic peoples. Similar to Scandinavian paganism, with parallel gods and practices, it nonetheless had its own unique practices and beliefs.
The High Priest, leading the international effort of bringing more people into the fold.

Germanic paganism refers to the diverse pre-Christian beliefs of the continental Germanic peoples. Similar to Scandinavian paganism, with parallel gods and practices, it nonetheless had its own unique practices and beliefs.
The High Priest, leading the international effort of bringing more people into the fold.

The Hellenistic religion is polytheistic, with a pantheon of twelve major gods including Jupiter, Mars, Mercury, Venus, Minerva and Vesta. It originated in ancient Greece and with the conquests of Alexander the Great and the Roman Empire, it would go on to become the dominant religion in the Mediterranean.
The High Priest, leading the international effort of bringing more people into the fold.

The Canaanites were a polytheistic religion that flourished in Ancient times, precursors to the dominance of the modern Hebrews. They worshipped the God Most High, El Elyon, above all others, but paid heed to a large number of other gods, each of whom held sway over important aspects of the world.
The High Priest, leading the international effort of bringing more people into the fold.

Mandaeism is a gnostic religion with a strongly dualistic worldview. Its adherents revere Adam, Abel, Seth, Enosh, Noah, Shem, Aram and especially John the Baptist, but reject Abraham, Moses and Jesus of Nazareth. It is represented in-game as an early form of Manichaeism, and a potential heresy should it resurface.
The High Priest, leading the international effort of bringing more people into the fold.

Prometheanism is the worship of the Titan Prometheus and, to a lesser extent, his brother Epimetheus, as the fathers of humanity. Prometheanism acknowledges the existence, and divinity, of the Hellenic gods, but rejects their worthiness as beings to be worshiped. Prometheans value intellectual pursuits above all, finding guile, diplomacy, and a quick wit to be the highest art forms. They find violence distasteful, but recognize that it is ocassionally necessary.
The High Priest, leading the international effort of bringing more people into the fold.

The Qarmatians are a splinter sect of Ismaili Islam, rooted in the Persian Gulf that mixes Islamic teachings with traditional Persian mysticism. They believed that there were seven ages of man, each with a new religion and prophet, and the final age was approaching.
The High Priest, leading the international effort of bringing more people into the fold.
Quranists hold the Qur'an to be the only authentic source of Islamic faith and reject the validity of the hadith and sharia law, considering them falsehoods.
The High Priest, leading the international effort of bringing more people into the fold.

The Cult of Titan rejects the authority of the Hellenic Gods, considering them usurpers and unworthy of their worship. Titan Cultists reject the kind of civilization Hellenism has typically fostered, and have much more in common with the more 'barbaric' religions.
The High Priest, leading the international effort of bringing more people into the fold.

Tondrakians are an anti-feudal, anti-church sect that originally flourished in Armenia between the 9th and 11th Century. They denied the immortality of the soul, the afterlife, and the rights of the church to rule over its fellow man. They supported property rights for peasants and equality between men and women.
The High Priest, leading the international effort of bringing more people into the fold.

Zurvanism is a branch of Zoroastrianism that believes in the existence of Zurvan, a genderless god of infinite time (and space), for whom there is no distinction between good and evil. Zurvan is the parent of the two opposites representing the good god, Ahura Mazda, and the evil Angra Mainyu, unlike normal Zoroastrianism, where Ahura Mazda is the Supreme Being.
The High Priest, leading the international effort of bringing more people into the fold.

The Cult of Balor worship Balor the Smiter, and refuse the shackles of conventional belief. Their spirituality is instead centered around personal gain and merciless vanquishing of ones enemies, condemning them in the eyes of traditional believers.
The High Priest of the Cult of Balor.
column6: El brahminrakshasa de los adoradores de Kali Purusha.

column2: The Children of Múspell are a secret society devoted to the study of dark sorcery and the veneration of the fire giant Surtr. Members believe in the power of destruction and will attempt to use dark magic to sate their greed and thirst for death. At Ragnarök they hope to join the forces of Hel and Loki in the fight against the other gods.
column3: Les Enfants de Múspell sont une société secrète consacrée à l'étude de la sorcellerie sombre et à la vénération du géant du feu Surtr. Les membres croient au pouvoir de la destruction et tenteront d'utiliser la magie noire pour assainir leur cupidité et leur soif de mort. À Ragnarök, ils espèrent rejoindre les forces d'Hel et Loki dans la lutte contre les autres dieux.
column4: Die Kinder von Múspell sind eine geheime Gesellschaft, die dem Studium der dunklen Zauberei und der Verehrung des Feuerriesen Surtr gewidmet ist. Die Mitglieder glauben an die Macht der Zerstörung und werden versuchen, dunkle Magie zu benutzen, um ihre Gier und Durst nach dem Tod zu sättigen. Bei Ragnarök hoffen sie, sich den Kräften von Hel und Loki im Kampf gegen die anderen Götter anzuschließen.
column6: Los Niños de Muspell son una sociedad secreta dedicada al estudio de la brujería oscura y la veneración del gigante del fuego Surtr. Los miembros creen en el poder de la destrucción e intentarán usar la magia oscura para saciar su codicia y sed de muerte. En Ragnarök esperan unirse a las fuerzas de Hel y Loki en la lucha contra los otros dioses.

column2: The Trollmaðr of the Children of Múspell.
column3: Le Trollmaðr de la Enfants de Múspell.
column4: Der Trollmaðr der Kinder von Múspell.
column6: El trollmaðr de los Niños de Múspell.

column2: Recruit to the Children of Múspell
column6: Recluta a los Niños de Múspell

column2: Has not been approached by the Children of Múspell.
column3: N'a pas déjà été approché par la Enfants de Múspell.
column4: Wurde noch nicht von den Kinder von Múspell kontaktiert.
column6: Nunca ha tenido contacto con los Niños de Múspell.

column2: Attempt to find out whether §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! is open to the power of the occult. If so, you may invite [Root.GetHerHim] to become a member of the Children of Múspell.
column3: Essayer de savoir si §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! est récepti[Root.GetFVe] aux puissances occultes. Si oui, vous pourrez l'inviter à devenir membre de la Enfants de Múspell.
column4: Versuche herauszufinden, ob §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! empfänglich für die Macht des Okkulten ist. Falls dem so ist, könnt Ihr [Root.GetHerHim] in die Kinder von Múspell einladen.
column6: Averigua si a §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! le atraen las fuerzas ocultas. En caso afirmativo, puedes invitarlo/la a unirse a los Niños de Múspell.

column2: The Mysteries of Isis worship the Egyptian goddess Isis. Not to be confused with the Cult of Isis, these followers are believers in primarily the Greco-Roman gods. Initiation requires a symbolic death and rebirth, guaranteeing the initiate's soul, with the help of their goddess, will continue into a blissfull afterlife.
The High Priest of the Mysteries of Isis, guardian of its secrets
Recruit to the Mysteries of Isis
The Kedeshah are an order of specially consecrated prostitutes who perform in rituals of worship and coronations for the followers of the Canaanite religion.
An order of Celtic poets and philosophers who are said to tell the future in verse.
An order of Celtic lawspeakers, well-versed in the law of the celtic world, called in to settle disputes of inheritance or other civil matters.
The Servants of the Aes Sídhe
A secretive order of Celtic men and women who revere the mysterious Aes Sídhe, known to other cultures by names such as "fairies" or "elves".
These are followers of the father of all Greek gods, Zeus, whom they worship and please to gain his favor and protection.
The high priest of the Cult of Zeus, guardian of its secrets.
Recruit to the Cult of Zeus

The Jinn Sorcerers have cast aside their worship of Allah, wether they are followers of Muhammad or non-Muslim worshippers of the local Gods. Instead they have turned to the Jinn, beings of smokeless flames, to give them access to unholy magics.
The Grand Sorceror, who has mastered all secrets of the Jinn.
Has not been approached by a Jinn Sorceror before.
Attempt to find out whether §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! is open to the power of the Jinn. If so, you may invite [Root.GetHerHim] to become a member of the Jinn Sorcerers.
